intro: Xanthophyllum flavescens var. virens, commonly known as the green-flowered yellowwood, is a flowering plant characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green foliage and small, clustered flowers. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth surface, while the flowers are usually pale yellow to green in color. This variant is notable for its unique coloration, which sets it apart from other varieties within the Xanthophyllum genus. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas.
